positive.review: vroid is an ever evolving and fun resource for making 3d models for vtubing, vrms for general use and artistic purposes and is coming along great with its resources and even with the built in resources is still great for people starting to work on it, i wish they had plugins / mods on the steam workshop as well but the internet provides a good source of plugins if you need them. i highly recommend it for people new to vtubing and wanting to make models for themselves or people just wanting to express themselves in a 3d format for fun.
a lot of options and pretty easy to use, i use it to make models for MateEngine :)

I absolutely love VRoid! First started using it back when it was in beta, and then the standalone stable version. Then, I decided to switch over to the Steam version in order to get the automatic updates.

The main appeal when I first downloaded VRoid was the ability to draw my characters' hair. However, after using it for these past years, I've grown accustomed to using the parameters and even creating a spreadsheet with formulas for further calculations to get everything laid out exactly how I want it.

The characters have a wide variety of uses, and can be used commercially. For example, I use my models as a basis for the art in my novel series, The Magical Girl in PROXY, by exporting them into Blender to pose in scenes, then render and edit in Clip Studio Paint.

The program is very beautiful and useful, and I would like it even more if the parameters were clearer and it had more settings for designing more creative characters other than human ones, such as making them like a bird, a fox, or a butterfly.
VRoid Studio is helping me to create my VERY first V-tuber model and I'm ecstatic with how easy it is!

If you are a vtuber or need this. I recommend it. It is pretty easy to use. It is also very fun. I've spent over 12 hours in it and I just started using it 2 days ago or so. It also has a lot of free items and also free items in the store. Though I am a bit nervous with the store but it seems good for if I need stuff.

An easy-to-learn avatar creation program for making anime/manga-style human avatars. I love the amount of preset options and the ability to import textures and items too. Sometimes buggy, especially when trying to optimise for a vrm export.
Easy to learn, and pretty good at in game customization of every individual clothing model, that with the added ability to import models makes it easy do do basically whatever you want.
Wish there's more customizations, but free is already good enough as this program was. good for beginner to learn media drawing too honestly

Didn't cause stutter or issues. Made my own VRM with some use of blender and a 3D model. Enjoyed my games while some dinosaurs danced like Anime chicks when I listened to music and watched a movie intently. Sometimes they'd wave their little hands with joy.

I won't lie. I am on meds that had me on a 3 week binger with maybe 30 hours of total sleep because insomnia is a cool side effect. It's why I even did what I did and I have no regrets. I wish it would maybe interact / talk / learn more but I didn't dive too deep into it. Seems like the Acrocanthosaurus mostly just told me to look at it while it dances and that it is a super star... yes, yes you are.

good way to make humanoid 3D models, if you want to try and experiment with the limits it allows you to do so, only limits are your imagination and tools outside of this program 

I suggest pairing it with PMX or other programs that allow you to change the parent of bones, physics and to change what bones items are weighted to :)
easy to use easy to make clothes and outfits for characters
Models cool
its soooo cute
Great for gamedev
I love vroid a lot
good pure good
It cool
greatness
i cant draw for shit
Peak
anime

An excellent animation and modeling tool beginner friendly start making your own VRM models for Vtubers, VRChat, modeling clothing and just for fun. Customization your hair, and more want horns or cat ears make them right down to glasses, earring and more..   

 ++++++ Pros VRoid Studio Pros ++++++
 
Pros + It's free
Pros+ Beginner friendly animation and modeling tool be patient while learning 
Pros+ Customization from facial features, hair, accessories want make cat ears or horns made it right down to glasses. 

 ------ VRoid Studio Cons ------
Cons - Limited clothing options 
Cons -  Can be lagging at times
Cons - Can take some time and patient to learn


Helpful Tipsüëâ For new VTubers 

üëáFor Obs Studio or OBS Streamlabs use üëá (o_O) ? 

Have your VTuber software download and make sure to download Spout2 Plugin for OBS than install make sure the install location is c:\programfiles\obs-studio finish install . Open your VTuber software go to setting or sometime it will be in your camera setting look for Spout2 Config and activate Spout2. Now open Obs Studio or OBS Streamlabs click the + to add source you'll see your new source called Spout2 Capture click on that create a new Spout2 Capture. Then you'll see the properties pop up on the screen here you will see Spout Sender choose you VTuber software as the output. Ok next is the composite mode it will be default to opaque. Opaque is for if you want use a background for your VTuber character if you want the green screen effect without a background change to default. Now your officially done welcome to the world of being a VTuber if this helped you in anyway i would to hear it !!! ‡πë(‚óï‚Äø‚óï)‡πë 

Helpful Tipsüëâ Booth for more clothing some are even free. 
 
 üëáBoothüëá (o_O) ?
 
Booth have more clothing, hair and even accessories some are free check it out if making your own clothing not for you or for ideas.

One of the best and most customizable programs I have used! I really enjoy every part of it!! Only wish I have Is more customizable options for male characters but I truly have nothing I could complain about

Many may say it is clearly visible if a model is made in vroid, but I say: That's a skill issue.

I've been using Vroid Studio for a few years now, starting with the Beta version when i just learned about Vtubing, and it is a great, free tool for character creation, the limit is your perseverance and imagination. 


[u]The positives:[/u]
- you have so many sliders - where you can even go beyond the numbers
- every surface is your canvas, and you can export the guides & layers for texturing outside of the program
- the hair tool is possibly one of the most flexible tools in the program
- you don't have to learn blender or unity, you get your fully rigged model straight from vroid
- there are many additional programs you can download to further advance your model

[u]The negatives:[/u]
- too many clothing layers will result in terribly laggy models - and many vroid-model specific tools require you to not use the delete transparent mesh option - aka, optimization tools could use more options (like 'leave face mesh as is')
- sometimes it does feel limiting what clothes can do as there are not enough 'unique' clothing meshes
- if you want high quality or custom brushes for your texturing, you have to texture in an external program
- some functions are almost nowhere to be found, like moving the camera, etc. - custom keybinding, or at least a list of keybindings would be neat


Vroid has a lot of potential still, and it is already very powerful - especially if you do branch out to learning blender and unity to edit what you made in vroid you can really achieve amazing models. For a free program it is honestly crazy.

The program is very beautiful and useful, and I would like it even more if the parameters were clearer and it had more settings for designing more creative characters other than human ones, such as making them like a bird, a fox, or a butterfly.

Easy to use and pretty powerful for what it is. Great starter program to create .VRM models to use in Desktop AI Companion.
Also Check out VRoidHub to find several free models too

vroid is an ever evolving and fun resource for making 3d models for vtubing, vrms for general use and artistic purposes and is coming along great with its resources and even with the built in resources is still great for people starting to work on it, i wish they had plugins / mods on the steam workshop as well but the internet provides a good source of plugins if you need them. i highly recommend it for people new to vtubing and wanting to make models for themselves or people just wanting to express themselves in a 3d format for fun.
Exelente, es la forma mas facil de tener un avatar para un proyecto personal o iniciarte el el streaming.
Best option for anyone wanting to make free models. All it requires is a bit of patience and a lot of creativity
a lot of options and pretty easy to use, i use it to make models for MateEngine :)
Good for basic characters once you get the basic way of how it works. I can admit I quit when i first used it, but it's pretty good!!
very beginner friendly and easy to use to make 3d models, especially for vtubing as the models work with motion capture.

Best option for newly starting vtubers with no budget. Put in the time and effort and it'll still look really good and unique :)
simple once you get the hang of it, i use it occasionally when I get bored and for general ideas
Awesome fun and quick way to create some amazing characters! Enjoy this a lot!

its actually good
use it for 3d avtars like in vrchat or....idk if u want to be vtuber
Very easy to use highly recommended for early vtubers and people using apps like mate-engine or desktop-mate

This is AMAZING. Presets, customization without modeling and without blender. Everything about it is great!!! The only thing that i can't do is set up my webcam and use it for the character, but either way, great!! ^^

Super helpful and awesome tool. As a guy who already does a lot of 3D modelling by themselves in programs like Blender, but never really got into modeling humans, this tool is very helpful. This program, for me, provides a good foundation to which I can later modify in blender into my different needs.

Extremely useful 
might look scary at first but there are many presets and youtube tutorials!

Didn't cause stutter or issues. Made my own VRM with some use of blender and a 3D model. Enjoyed my games while some dinosaurs danced like Anime chicks when I listened to music and watched a movie intently. Sometimes they'd wave their little hands with joy.

I won't lie. I am on meds that had me on a 3 week binger with maybe 30 hours of total sleep because insomnia is a cool side effect. It's why I even did what I did and I have no regrets. I wish it would maybe interact / talk / learn more but I didn't dive too deep into it. Seems like the Acrocanthosaurus mostly just told me to look at it while it dances and that it is a super star... yes, yes you are.

good way to make humanoid 3D models, if you want to try and experiment with the limits it allows you to do so, only limits are your imagination and tools outside of this program 

I suggest pairing it with PMX or other programs that allow you to change the parent of bones, physics and to change what bones items are weighted to :)

This is an excellent tool if you are a beginner in modeling and animation. All the tools you need to make a character are available within the app, and exporting to other tools like Blender is easy with a plugin or two.
worth using as a free software for commercial purposes or personal preferences in 3D modelling

massively underrated in the vtubing community. dont listen to reviews complaining you can only make samefaced characters, they just dont know how to take advantage of the tools provided (though i will admit, this is because vroid doesnt make them the easiest to find) or find/make their own textures. with a little tweaking, you can completely change the way the character looks. While the texture editor is a little underwhelming, i figure this is because they know there's already so many other apps that can use to edit the saved templates from vroid just as well. A great free option for anyone not wanting to sell their soul for a 2d model, figure out the hellscape that is 3d modelling from scratch, or just wants to mess around a bit with a character.

An easy-to-learn avatar creation program for making anime/manga-style human avatars. I love the amount of preset options and the ability to import textures and items too. Sometimes buggy, especially when trying to optimise for a vrm export.

negative.review:
VRoid Studio v2.5.0 is....: software for V-Tubers, basically if you don't know what a V-Tuber is, to start with, congratulations on the higher quality of life you have, but basically it's when middle aged men pretend to be little anime girls on streams. This software allows those middle-aged men to create and edit their little anime girl avatars that they use.

While it's inexplicably popular (presumably it needs to run while pretending to be a little anime girl), the tool has issues with performance, bad texture editing capabilities, poor translation, [and] limits on the kinds of avatars you can make (apparently almost exclusively little anime girls, but hey, they know their audience).

I can't think of anyone I could recommend this to and I feel it's not exactly the best example of software in the genre. Look elsewhere for your little anime girl avatar requirements.
this app does not work you can import fucking anything good fucking bye

I decided to give a negative review after actually trying to make custom textures in the program. Vroid needs to stop making pre-made assets, and focus on their in house art program for editing textures because it is god awful to work with. It's exhausting having to hop back between Vroid and an art program to adjust tiny details. If your program relies on editing textures in house, you have to give your users a proper in house art program. 

The biggest issue is that needs to be fixed asap is that there no pen stabilization, so if your design requires neat lines or edges, you need to already have the ability to make clean lines without stabilization. Adding a line tool should be next in line.


There was an amazing mod a few years ago that someone made that allowed you to edit textures in an art program, and it would apply it in real time in Vroid. It also had other QoL changes that improved the program, but Vroid made it impossible to use now. I don't understand how a random person could make game changing QoL changes in their free time, but the devs couldn't be bothered to the same work. Instead they just make pre-made assets and release them once in a while.

If you are just wanting to make models for fun using other people's assets, then this is a good program. If you want to make very customized characters that look good, I cannot recommend this app. Unless you feel like you can put up with the frustration and wasting more time trying to draw textures that look good.

as much as i wanna reccomend this application, (ive spent hundreds of hours using it) the newest update nearly bricked my pc. and completely halted my workflow on my pc for several days while i tried to fix it, as i couldnt do anything on my pc when it happened.
if you decide to use it, for the love of god do not ever let an update pause halfway through update.

VRoid Studio v2.5.0 is....: software for V-Tubers, basically if you don't know what a V-Tuber is, to start with, congratulations on the higher quality of life you have, but basically it's when middle aged men pretend to be little anime girls on streams. This software allows those middle-aged men to create and edit their little anime girl avatars that they use.

While it's inexplicably popular (presumably it needs to run while pretending to be a little anime girl), the tool has issues with performance, bad texture editing capabilities, poor translation, [and] limits on the kinds of avatars you can make (apparently almost exclusively little anime girls, but hey, they know their audience).

I can't think of anyone I could recommend this to and I feel it's not exactly the best example of software in the genre. Look elsewhere for your little anime girl avatar requirements.

Don't know if this is an issue for anyone else, but I tried downloading Vroid Studio from their website and I couldn't get any sample models to tinker around with all I got were 3 blank slots. I tried to install via steam and got the same problem. And from the looks of it there's no options to download via Vroid community hub. I was hoping to create some models for Mate Engine, but it's been frustrating to get assets. This is coming from someone who uses Koikatsu and used to open source.

as much as i wanna reccomend this application, (ive spent hundreds of hours using it) the newest update nearly bricked my pc. and completely halted my workflow on my pc for several days while i tried to fix it, as i couldnt do anything on my pc when it happened.
if you decide to use it, for the love of god do not ever let an update pause halfway through update.

VRoid Studio v2.5.0 is....: software for V-Tubers, basically if you don't know what a V-Tuber is, to start with, congratulations on the higher quality of life you have, but basically it's when middle aged men pretend to be little anime girls on streams. This software allows those middle-aged men to create and edit their little anime girl avatars that they use.

While it's inexplicably popular (presumably it needs to run while pretending to be a little anime girl), the tool has issues with performance, bad texture editing capabilities, poor translation, [and] limits on the kinds of avatars you can make (apparently almost exclusively little anime girls, but hey, they know their audience).

I can't think of anyone I could recommend this to and I feel it's not exactly the best example of software in the genre. Look elsewhere for your little anime girl avatar requirements.

Don't know if this is an issue for anyone else, but I tried downloading Vroid Studio from their website and I couldn't get any sample models to tinker around with all I got were 3 blank slots. I tried to install via steam and got the same problem. And from the looks of it there's no options to download via Vroid community hub. I was hoping to create some models for Mate Engine, but it's been frustrating to get assets. This is coming from someone who uses Koikatsu and used to open source.
this app does not work you can import fucking anything good fucking bye
bruh....

I decided to give a negative review after actually trying to make custom textures in the program. Vroid needs to stop making pre-made assets, and focus on their in house art program for editing textures because it is god awful to work with. It's exhausting having to hop back between Vroid and an art program to adjust tiny details. If your program relies on editing textures in house, you have to give your users a proper in house art program. 

The biggest issue is that needs to be fixed asap is that there no pen stabilization, so if your design requires neat lines or edges, you need to already have the ability to make clean lines without stabilization. Adding a line tool should be next in line.


There was an amazing mod a few years ago that someone made that allowed you to edit textures in an art program, and it would apply it in real time in Vroid. It also had other QoL changes that improved the program, but Vroid made it impossible to use now. I don't understand how a random person could make game changing QoL changes in their free time, but the devs couldn't be bothered to the same work. Instead they just make pre-made assets and release them once in a while.

If you are just wanting to make models for fun using other people's assets, then this is a good program. If you want to make very customized characters that look good, I cannot recommend this app. Unless you feel like you can put up with the frustration and wasting more time trying to draw textures that look good.
